meanings.definition: A person, especially a man, who behaves in a dishonorable or contemptible way.
meanings.sent1: The blackguards in the story were always causing trouble.
meanings.sent2: The town was wary of the blackguards who roamed the streets at night.
meanings.sent3: The blackguards tried to steal the cookies from the jar, but got caught red-handed.
meanings.sent4: The blackguards of society lurked in the shadows, preying on the vulnerable.
meanings.sent5: The image of the blackguards sneaking around stayed in her mind, a reminder of danger.

meanings.sent1: She blackguards anyone who disagrees with her opinions.
meanings.sent2: The journalist decided to blackguard the corrupt officials in his article.
meanings.sent3: He blackguards the weather whenever it rains, blaming it for his bad mood.
meanings.sent4: The coach blackguards the players for their lack of effort on the field.
meanings.sent5: Her tendency to blackguard others made her unpopular among her peers.
